opinion: flavorful food, but ... yes ... a little on the greasy side
goes on and off early, sometimes 5pm to 9pm
just good ole fashioned Louisiana fun
Situated in an old house down by the SAP Arena
the food is good and moderately priced
they often have live music going
There is a VERY small amount of seating inside but that okay
All the fun happens out on what was once the driveway on the side of the house!
In cold weather, they have plenty of propane heat lamps all over the place to keep you more than warm enough

The food is just what youd expect to find, Shrimp PoBoys, Sausage Bread (french bread stuffed with italian sausage, served with creole mustard), couple of different varieties of Gumbo and Blackened Chicken & Tasso Pasta (I loved this one!)
Save some room for the Bread Pudding and plan to share it. Its DELISH!
I wouldnt go out of my way to come here, this is a place you eat if you happen to be in the area
The frying is done right, judging by the shrimp
too dry for me and nursing cayenne
good, Cajun style (as opposed to Creole), but lacking heat that cayenne should have brought tho the dish
passable as Creole, but could have used a bit more distinction
Probably come back for that and a shot at another poboy or a muffaletta
I rounded up food wise since I heard there is a fair bit of variation among cooks
feels like youve stepped out of San Jose
nothing was bursting with flavor except for the red beans which were delicious
expecting a little more spice since it was a Cajun place
Very charming place with live jazz
